3/4) assisting look for the engaginghackers.\\\\nETH Denver judging\\\\nInteraction with NEAR Campus events and initiatives.\\\\n\\\\n# ETH Oxford - NFT-Soho - ETH London\\\\nTimeline\\\\nStart Date: March 7, 2024\\\\n\\\\nEnd Date: March 17, 2024\\\\n\\\\nRequested Funding\\\\nHours: 87\\\\n\\\\nRate: $50/hour\\\\n\\\\n**Sub-Total Amount: $4,350**\\\\n\\\\n**Summary of Activities**\\\\nSupporting developers with questions they have through Telegram.\\\\nInteraction with NEAR Campus events and initiatives.\\\\nLogstic support in the events.\\\\nETH Oxford prep calls.\\\\nETH Oxford support (6/4 - 10/4) guide hackers to use near and assisting them.\\\\nETH Oxford judging.\\\\nETH NFT-Soho prep calls.\\\\nETH NFT-Soho support (13/4) guide hackers to use near and assisting them.\\\\nETH NFT-Soho judging.\\\\nETH London prep call.\\\\nETH London support (23/3 - 3/4) guide hackers to use near and assisting them.\\\\nETH London judging\\\\n\\\\n# Expenses\\\\n\\\\nExpenses for ETH Denver, ETH Oxford, ETH London and NFT-Soho hackathons and events.\\\\n\\\\nI provided DevRel support at ETH Denver (February 23, 2024 - March 3, 2024), ETH Oxford - NFT-SOHO - ETH London (March 7, 2024 - March 17, 2024) and ETH Samba (March 21, 2024 - March 24, 2024).\\\\n\\\\n**Requested\\\\nTotal: $2,720.75**\\\\n\\\\n**Details**\\\\n# ETH Denver\\\\nFlights: $148.91\\\\nOther travel costs (taxi, train, bus) : $251.90\\\\nFood : $215.85\\\\n\\\\n**Sub-Total: $616.66**\\\\nhttps://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1io8QopXmwfwANJd8qoNxj8gdvkODh7RkArVwWETljT0/edit?usp=sharing\\\\n**support o invoices**\\\\nhttps://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1z3-MQ3Kw2ZbK_RFcRZMeuOoXuxw9Ey58?usp=sharing\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n# ETH Oxford - NFT-Soho - ETH London\\\\nFlights: $$858.00\\\\nHotel (4 nights): $504.32 + $108.52 = $612.84\\\\nOther travel costs (taxi, train, bus) : $124.90\\\\nFood : $244.33\\\\n\\\\n**Sub-Total: $1,840.98**\\\\nhttps://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1p6-wnC3Wm8sA0--30LOpRqkuTXZZk--LdCsKUnHq4Eo/edit?usp=sharing\\\\n**support o invoices**\\\\nhttps://drive.google.com/drive/folders/14O9EornPq1DA1Y_fDKiyiC04niIqompH?usp=drive_link\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n# TOTAL \\\\n**Expenses + Hours**\\\\n**Total: $10,757.64**\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "umerez.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "10758", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackathon"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 128763933}

10/4) guide hackers to use near and assisting them.\\\\nETH Oxford judging.\\\\nETH NFT-Soho prep calls.\\\\nETH NFT-Soho support (13/4) guide hackers to use near and assisting them.\\\\nETH NFT-Soho judging.\\\\nETH London prep call.\\\\nETH London support (23/3 - 3/4) guide hackers to use near and assisting them.\\\\nETH London judging\\\\n\\\\n# Expenses\\\\n\\\\nExpenses for ETH Denver, ETH Oxford, ETH London and NFT-Soho hackathons and events.\\\\n\\\\nI provided DevRel support at ETH Denver (February 23, 2024 - March 3, 2024), ETH Oxford - NFT-SOHO - ETH London (March 7, 2024 - March 17, 2024) and ETH Samba (March 21, 2024 - March 24, 2024).\\\\n\\\\n**Requested\\\\nTotal: $2,720.75**\\\\n\\\\n**Details**\\\\n# ETH Denver\\\\nFlights: $148.91\\\\nOther travel costs (taxi, train, bus) : $251.90\\\\nFood : $215.85\\\\n\\\\n**Sub-Total: $616.66**\\\\nhttps://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1io8QopXmwfwANJd8qoNxj8gdvkODh7RkArVwWETljT0/edit?usp=sharing\\\\n**support o invoices**\\\\nhttps://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1z3-MQ3Kw2ZbK_RFcRZMeuOoXuxw9Ey58?usp=sharing\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n# ETH Oxford - NFT-Soho - ETH London\\\\nFlights: $$858.00\\\\nHotel (4 nights): $504.32 + $108.52 = $612.84\\\\nOther travel costs (taxi, train, bus) : $124.90\\\\nFood : $244.33\\\\n\\\\n**Sub-Total: $1,840.98**\\\\nhttps://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1p6-wnC3Wm8sA0--30LOpRqkuTXZZk--LdCsKUnHq4Eo/edit?usp=sharing\\\\n**support o invoices**\\\\nhttps://drive.google.com/drive/folders/14O9EornPq1DA1Y_fDKiyiC04niIqompH?usp=drive_link\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n# TOTAL \\\\n**Expenses + Hours**\\\\n**Total: $10,757.64**\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "umerez.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "10758", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "umerez.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"body": {"name": "Open Web House [REDACTED] city node  - Powered by Hackbox", "summary": "Open Web House [REDACTED] Powered by Hackbox is a hackathon where blockchain technologies are used to create prototypes. EVM\\\\\\'s backend technology and NEAR\\\\\\'s easy Blockchain Operating System (BOS) frontend tools generate disruptive and scalable solutions to current Web 3.0 problems.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": null, "description": "TL;DR\\\\u{26a1}\\\\nOpen Web House [REDACTED] Powered by Hackbox is a hackathon where blockchain technologies are used to create prototypes. EVM\\\\\\'s backend technology and NEAR\\\\\\'s easy Blockchain Operating System (BOS) frontend tools generate disruptive and scalable solutions to current Web 3.0 problems.\\\\n\\\\nPast hackathons:\\\\nPuerto Vallarta M\\\\u{e9}xico, november 2022 | See more\\\\nGuadalajara M\\\\u{e9}xico, march 2023 | See more\\\\nMonterrey M\\\\u{e9}xico, may 2023 at CriptoM\\\\u{e9}xico | See more\\\\nCiudad de M\\\\u{e9}xico, october 2023 at Ethereum M\\\\u{e9}xico 2023 | See more\\\\nM\\\\u{e9}rida M\\\\u{e9}xico, september 2024 at Ethereum M\\\\u{e9}xico 2024 | See more\\\\n\\\\nHackathon Overview\\\\nDate: \\\\tOctober 17-19, 2024 \\\\nFormat: IRL\\\\nLocation: M\\\\u{e9}xico\\\\n\\\\nOrganizer Team \\\\nOrganizers: Open Web Academy\\\\nPartnerships: General Coordination of Polytechnic and Technological Universities of Nayarit, INJUVE.\\\\n\\\\nEvent Objectives\\\\nGoals\\\\nFoster innovation and problem-solving through the development of blockchain solutions using BOS and EVMs\\\\nDemonstrate BOS and EVM\\\\u{2019}s unique capabilities and potential to transform various industries jointly.\\\\nIncrease adoption and continued use of decentralized BOS tools.\\\\n\\\\nTarget Audience\\\\nFullstack developers, Javascript developers, general devs, university students and IT professionals.\\\\nChallenges & Themes\\\\nChain abstraction\\\\nIntroduction\\\\nChain abstraction is transforming the way developers build blockchain applications by simplifying cross-chain interactions and enabling decentralized applications to work seamlessly across multiple blockchain networks. With chain abstraction, developers can create a unified experience that abstracts away the complexities of different chains, such as transaction formats, consensus mechanisms, and token standards. This approach opens up possibilities for truly interoperable applications that can leverage the strengths of multiple blockchains, such as NEAR, Ethereum, Solana, Polkadot, and more.\\\\nExpected solution\\\\nA fully functional dApp that uses chain abstraction techniques to interact with multiple blockchains, providing a unified and simplified user experience.\\\\nThe dApp should enable actions such as cross-chain token transfers, asset swaps, or data synchronization, with all complexity hidden from the end user.\\\\n\\\\nBitte Protocol\\\\nIntroduction\\\\nThe future of Web3 is AI. As open source models flourish and decentralized infrastructure evolves, the integration of strong cryptocurrency custody, a simpler user experience (via AI prompts and agents), and advanced AI control has the potential to transform Web3. We expect to see agents that improve security, enhance privacy, increase adoption, and support decentralized governance.\\\\n\\\\nBy registering your agent as a plugin in the Bitte Wallet, you will allow Bitte Wallet users to take advantage of the launch of an agent that Bitte Wallet users will be able to interact with directly through the AI \\\\u{200b}\\\\u{200b}tab in the Bitte Wallet.\\\\n\\\\nExpected Solution\\\\nSuccessful submissions will achieve plugin verification within the Bitte Wallet.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nDecentralized IA \\\\nIntroduction\\\\nThe intersection of AI and blockchain technology is revolutionizing the decentralized ecosystem. By integrating AI into decentralized systems, we can improve decision-making, automate complex processes, and deliver personalized user experiences, all while maintaining privacy and security. With platforms like NEAR Protocol, we can deploy AI models that operate on a decentralized infrastructure, ensuring data integrity and censorship resistance. Your task is to leverage these technologies to build an AI-powered dApp (decentralized application) that interacts with blockchain smart contracts, providing unique and valuable services to users.\\\\n\\\\nExpected Solution \\\\nA fully functional AI-powered dApp that consumes and interacts with a smart contract, adding significant value to the user.\\\\nUse cases can include predictive analytics, autonomous agents, recommendation engines, or any AI-driven decision-making system that operates in a decentralized environment.\\\\n\\\\nSchedule and Activities\\\\nDuration: 3 days IRL\\\\n\\\\nKey Activities\\\\nHour\\\\nDay 1\\\\nDay 2\\\\nDay 3\\\\nTBD\\\\nOpening\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nIdea planning talk\\\\nBuilding time\\\\nIntroductory talk on blockchain\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nDesign thinking talk\\\\nSmart contract development workshop\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nMentoring session for idea validation\\\\nMentoring session to monitor progress\\\\nLunch\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nBuilding time\\\\nFinal pitch and prizes\\\\nDecentralized frontend development workshop\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nKPIs\\\\u{1f3af}\\\\n120 registered participants\\\\n10-15 projects created using Blockchain Operating System technology or decentralized IA\\\\n100 new NEAR Protocol wallets\\\\nPartner with 3 universities for the celebration of the hackathon\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nBudget\\\\nTo see the full cost breakdown of the event, please visit the following document\\\\nBudget layout - M\\\\u{e9}xico node\\\\nTotal for the hackathon 14250 USD + 3000 USD in prizes.\\\\n\\\\nBounties and Prizes\\\\nEach proposed bounty can be awarded with up to 1000 USD, this will vary depending on the level of development achieved and the viability of the proposed project.\\\\nThe prize delivery process will be carried out by hackbox, once the Open Web Academy notifies the winners of the different challenges. Each awarded team must go through the processes required to collect the prizes.\\\\n\\\\nJudging Criteria\\\\nWhile it is true that each challenge will have its own particular criteria for evaluation, all will follow a common line to measure the level of development: Ready to use and validated, Deployed, Idea and simulation.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nLevel\\\\nAcceptance criteria\\\\nReady to use and validated\\\\n* Prototype deployed on mainnet * An iteration was made to test its value proposition to users. * It makes use of NEAR in its infrastructure to build its value proposition.\\\\nDeployed\\\\n* Prototype deployed on mainnet * Has a defined market and value proposition. * Makes use of NEAR in its infrastructure to build its value proposition.\\\\nIdea and simulation\\\\n*Presents a mockup or UI design to help evaluate the idea. *Uses NEAR in its infrastructure to build its value proposition.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nMarketing and Promotion\\\\nTBD\\\\n\\\\nContact Information\\\\nOur team includes:\\\\nAlan Estrada (@alan777.near): NEAR certified developer and co-founder of web 3.0 projects at NEAR.\\\\nIrving Cari\\\\u{f1}o (@izcc.near): Certified NEAR Analyst, NEAR Professor and Google Lv2 Professor.\\\\nOur social networks\\\\nWebsite: https://ow.academy\\\\nYoutube: youtube/OpenWebAcademy\\\\nTwitter: https://twitter.com/openwebacademy_\\\\nTelegram: Telegram: Contact @openwebhouse\\\\nDiscord: Open Web Academy\\\\nMedium: Open Web Academy \\\\u{2013} Medium\\\\nGithub: https://github.com/open-web-academy \\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "open-web-academy.sputnik-dao.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "14250", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackathon", "Hackbox"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 128799006}

EVM\\\\\\'s backend technology and NEAR\\\\\\'s easy Blockchain Operating System (BOS) frontend tools generate disruptive and scalable solutions to current Web 3.0 problems.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=44)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

EVM\\\\\\'s backend technology and NEAR\\\\\\'s easy Blockchain Operating System (BOS) frontend tools generate disruptive and scalable solutions to current Web 3.0 problems.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "editor_id": "irvingzcc.near", "timestamp": "1727191965148247112", "supervisor": null, "description": "TL;DR\\\\u{26a1}\\\\nOpen Web House [REDACTED] Powered by Hackbox is a hackathon where blockchain technologies are used to create prototypes. EVM\\\\\\'s backend technology and NEAR\\\\\\'s easy Blockchain Operating System (BOS) frontend tools generate disruptive and scalable solutions to current Web 3.0 problems.\\\\n\\\\nPast hackathons:\\\\nPuerto Vallarta M\\\\u{e9}xico, november 2022 | See more\\\\nGuadalajara M\\\\u{e9}xico, march 2023 | See more\\\\nMonterrey M\\\\u{e9}xico, may 2023 at CriptoM\\\\u{e9}xico | See more\\\\nCiudad de M\\\\u{e9}xico, october 2023 at Ethereum M\\\\u{e9}xico 2023 | See more\\\\nM\\\\u{e9}rida M\\\\u{e9}xico, september 2024 at Ethereum M\\\\u{e9}xico 2024 | See more\\\\n\\\\nHackathon Overview\\\\nDate: \\\\tOctober 17-19, 2024 \\\\nFormat: IRL\\\\nLocation: M\\\\u{e9}xico\\\\n\\\\nOrganizer Team \\\\nOrganizers: Open Web Academy\\\\nPartnerships: General Coordination of Polytechnic and Technological Universities of Nayarit, INJUVE.\\\\n\\\\nEvent Objectives\\\\nGoals\\\\nFoster innovation and problem-solving through the development of blockchain solutions using BOS and EVMs\\\\nDemonstrate BOS and EVM\\\\u{2019}s unique capabilities and potential to transform various industries jointly.\\\\nIncrease adoption and continued use of decentralized BOS tools.\\\\n\\\\nTarget Audience\\\\nFullstack developers, Javascript developers, general devs, university students and IT professionals.\\\\nChallenges & Themes\\\\nChain abstraction\\\\nIntroduction\\\\nChain abstraction is transforming the way developers build blockchain applications by simplifying cross-chain interactions and enabling decentralized applications to work seamlessly across multiple blockchain networks. With chain abstraction, developers can create a unified experience that abstracts away the complexities of different chains, such as transaction formats, consensus mechanisms, and token standards. This approach opens up possibilities for truly interoperable applications that can leverage the strengths of multiple blockchains, such as NEAR, Ethereum, Solana, Polkadot, and more.\\\\nExpected solution\\\\nA fully functional dApp that uses chain abstraction techniques to interact with multiple blockchains, providing a unified and simplified user experience.\\\\nThe dApp should enable actions such as cross-chain token transfers, asset swaps, or data synchronization, with all complexity hidden from the end user.\\\\n\\\\nBitte Protocol\\\\nIntroduction\\\\nThe future of Web3 is AI. As open source models flourish and decentralized infrastructure evolves, the integration of strong cryptocurrency custody, a simpler user experience (via AI prompts and agents), and advanced AI control has the potential to transform Web3. We expect to see agents that improve security, enhance privacy, increase adoption, and support decentralized governance.\\\\n\\\\nBy registering your agent as a plugin in the Bitte Wallet, you will allow Bitte Wallet users to take advantage of the launch of an agent that Bitte Wallet users will be able to interact with directly through the AI \\\\u{200b}\\\\u{200b}tab in the Bitte Wallet.\\\\n\\\\nExpected Solution\\\\nSuccessful submissions will achieve plugin verification within the Bitte Wallet.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nDecentralized IA \\\\nIntroduction\\\\nThe intersection of AI and blockchain technology is revolutionizing the decentralized ecosystem. By integrating AI into decentralized systems, we can improve decision-making, automate complex processes, and deliver personalized user experiences, all while maintaining privacy and security. With platforms like NEAR Protocol, we can deploy AI models that operate on a decentralized infrastructure, ensuring data integrity and censorship resistance. Your task is to leverage these technologies to build an AI-powered dApp (decentralized application) that interacts with blockchain smart contracts, providing unique and valuable services to users.\\\\n\\\\nExpected Solution \\\\nA fully functional AI-powered dApp that consumes and interacts with a smart contract, adding significant value to the user.\\\\nUse cases can include predictive analytics, autonomous agents, recommendation engines, or any AI-driven decision-making system that operates in a decentralized environment.\\\\n\\\\nSchedule and Activities\\\\nDuration: 3 days IRL\\\\n\\\\nKey Activities\\\\nHour\\\\nDay 1\\\\nDay 2\\\\nDay 3\\\\nTBD\\\\nOpening\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nIdea planning talk\\\\nBuilding time\\\\nIntroductory talk on blockchain\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nDesign thinking talk\\\\nSmart contract development workshop\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nMentoring session for idea validation\\\\nMentoring session to monitor progress\\\\nLunch\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nBuilding time\\\\nFinal pitch and prizes\\\\nDecentralized frontend development workshop\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nKPIs\\\\u{1f3af}\\\\n120 registered participants\\\\n10-15 projects created using Blockchain Operating System technology or decentralized IA\\\\n100 new NEAR Protocol wallets\\\\nPartner with 3 universities for the celebration of the hackathon\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nBudget\\\\nTo see the full cost breakdown of the event, please visit the following document\\\\nBudget layout - M\\\\u{e9}xico node\\\\nTotal for the hackathon 14250 USD + 3000 USD in prizes.\\\\n\\\\nBounties and Prizes\\\\nEach proposed bounty can be awarded with up to 1000 USD, this will vary depending on the level of development achieved and the viability of the proposed project.\\\\nThe prize delivery process will be carried out by hackbox, once the Open Web Academy notifies the winners of the different challenges. Each awarded team must go through the processes required to collect the prizes.\\\\n\\\\nJudging Criteria\\\\nWhile it is true that each challenge will have its own particular criteria for evaluation, all will follow a common line to measure the level of development: Ready to use and validated, Deployed, Idea and simulation.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nLevel\\\\nAcceptance criteria\\\\nReady to use and validated\\\\n* Prototype deployed on mainnet * An iteration was made to test its value proposition to users. * It makes use of NEAR in its infrastructure to build its value proposition.\\\\nDeployed\\\\n* Prototype deployed on mainnet * Has a defined market and value proposition. * Makes use of NEAR in its infrastructure to build its value proposition.\\\\nIdea and simulation\\\\n*Presents a mockup or UI design to help evaluate the idea. *Uses NEAR in its infrastructure to build its value proposition.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nMarketing and Promotion\\\\nTBD\\\\n\\\\nContact Information\\\\nOur team includes:\\\\nAlan Estrada (@alan777.near): NEAR certified developer and co-founder of web 3.0 projects at NEAR.\\\\nIrving Cari\\\\u{f1}o (@izcc.near): Certified NEAR Analyst, NEAR Professor and Google Lv2 Professor.\\\\nOur social networks\\\\nWebsite: https://ow.academy\\\\nYoutube: youtube/OpenWebAcademy\\\\nTwitter: https://twitter.com/openwebacademy_\\\\nTelegram: Telegram: Contact @openwebhouse\\\\nDiscord: Open Web Academy\\\\nMedium: Open Web Academy \\\\u{2013} Medium\\\\nGithub: https://github.com/open-web-academy \\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "open-web-academy.sputnik-dao.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "14250", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "irvingzcc.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"id": 42, "body": {"name": "Near Brazil + Partner: Tech Academy - From Basic to Advanced", "summary": "This proposal outlines the creation of a 2-4 month academy focused on Near technology, aiming to address the critical shortage of skilled developers in Brazil. This initiative, a collaborative effort between Near Brazil team and Partner, a social impact education organization, will equip participants with the necessary skills to develop innovative solutions and contribute to the Near ecosystem\\\\\\'s growth.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "kyc_verified": true, "sponsor_requested_review": true, "reviewer_completed_attestation": true}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "Short Description:\\\\nAn 2 to 4-month academy focusing on Near technology represents a pivotal strategic initiative to accelerate the adoption and expansion of the Near ecosystem. This academy will not only provide access to high-quality educational curriculum tailored to the nuances and specific applications of Near blockchain technology but will also act as a catalyst for nurturing new proficient developers within this platform. By offering comprehensive training that spans from basic to advanced concepts, participants will gain the necessary skills to innovate and make significant contributions to the ecosystem. Furthermore, this initiative is poised to foster a stronger and more diverse developer community, empowering professionals to tackle complex challenges and develop innovative decentralized solutions. The expected impact includes not only enlarging the talent pool of technically adept individuals to work with Near but also strengthening the network, promoting innovation, and accelerating the adoption of blockchain technologies across various industries.\\\\n\\\\nContext of the Proposal:\\\\nNear Development Academy in Partnership between Near Brazil team and Partner\\\\n\\\\nIntroduction:\\\\nWith the number of developers in Brazil increasing and the country positioning itself as an expanding market in the blockchain technology scene, emerging technologies such as Solana, Avalanche, Ethereum, Cosmos, and Polygon view Brazil as fertile ground for innovation and adoption. However, a common challenge faced by all these technologies is the scarcity of qualified developers or a solid base of developers familiar with their specific programming languages and SDKs.\\\\n\\\\nThe Need:\\\\nWe have identified a critical need to expand the base of skilled developers in Brazil, not just to meet current demand but also to position the country as a leader in the development of innovative blockchain solutions. The programming language Rust, along with Near\\\\\\'s SDK, are specific areas where the demand for skills significantly exceeds supply.\\\\n\\\\nThe Proposal: Near Development Academy:\\\\nIn response to this need, the Near Brazil team, in conjunction with the Technological Training School Partner, proposes the creation of an academy dedicated to attracting and training developers in Near technology. This program aims to equip participants with knowledge ranging from the basics of programming and algorithms to advanced development in Rust, using Near\\\\\\'s SDK.\\\\n\\\\nProgram Objectives:\\\\nThe program aims to train 30 developers highly skilled in Near technology, divided into teaching modalities:\\\\n\\\\nOnline: Targeted at 15 participants, offering flexibility and accessibility for those unable to participate in person.\\\\nIn-person: Providing 10 spots for those who prefer or benefit more from a classroom learning experience.\\\\nExpected Impact:\\\\nThe initiative seeks not only to fill the existing gap of qualified developers in emerging blockchain technologies in Brazil but also to stimulate innovation and the development of projects that can place the country at the forefront of blockchain technology. By doing so, we aim to contribute significantly to economic and technological growth and position Brazil as a center of excellence in blockchain.\\\\n\\\\nImportance for Business and Partnerships:\\\\nThis initiative is also critically important for businesses and the establishment of partnerships with companies looking to develop on Near and its ecosystem. By creating a skilled pool of developers familiar with Near\\\\\\'s technology, we are enabling the foundation for robust business collaborations and innovative projects. Partnerships with companies are essential for applying the developed skills in real-world scenarios, thereby fostering the growth of the Near ecosystem and providing tangible benefits to the Brazilian economy through technology transfer, job creation, and enhanced technological capabilities.\\\\n\\\\nConclusion:\\\\nThe collaboration between Near Brazil team and Partner represents a strategic and innovative step to address the challenge of the shortage of qualified developers in Brazil. With a clear focus on developing competencies in Rust, this academy promises not only to train the next generation of blockchain experts in Brazil but also to open doors for new technological and economic development opportunities in the country. This effort will be pivotal in enhancing business opportunities and fostering partnerships that will drive the future of blockchain technology in Brazil and beyond.\\\\n\\\\nProblem Statement:\\\\nWho does this solution help?\\\\nWhy Brazil?\\\\n\\\\nBrazil has stood as one of the world\\\\\\'s leading economies, and in 2022, the country\\\\\\'s Gross Domestic Product (GDP) amounted to a staggering BRL 9.9 trillion. This figure reflects the sum of all wealth produced within Brazilian territory during that year, underscoring Brazil\\\\\\'s importance on the global economic stage.\\\\n\\\\nLooking at the latest data, we can see that in the first quarter of 2023, Brazil\\\\\\'s GDP reached BRL 2,556.5 billion. This suggests that the Brazilian economy maintained a strong and steady pace of growth, which is a positive sign for the future.\\\\n\\\\nBeing present at flagship blockchain events such as Blockchain Rio helps the overall Near ecosystem, increasing the brand visibility and providing opportunities for ecosystem growth.\\\\n\\\\nThe primary target audience consists of developers of all levels and builders/startups (founders and CTOs/technical decision-makers).\\\\n\\\\nAccording to new data released by the Federal Revenue Service, Brazil now has almost 10 million cryptocurrency investors, the highest number since the agency began receiving declarations of digital assets from individuals and brokers based in the country.\\\\n\\\\nIn the report for the month of April, the Revenue registered 1,996,165 CPFs (Brazilian individual taxpayer registry identification) involved in crypto transactions, 19.2% more than in March. The number of CNPJs (National Registry of Legal Entities) also increased: for the first time, it surpassed 65,000.\\\\n\\\\nThe growth occurred amid a broad recovery of Bitcoin in the first months of the year. Now, the digital currency rose strongly and briefly reached $30,000, almost a 100% increase compared to its worst moment in 2022, in November.\\\\n\\\\nBrazil, the largest and most populated country in Latin America, has emerged as a significant player in digital and financial technology, fueled by its young median age of 32 and high mobile and internet usage rates. The country boasts around 212 million inhabitants and is ranked fifth globally in terms of cryptocurrency ownership. Brazil is the fifth largest cryptocurrency market on the planet, behind only India, USA, Russia, and Nigeria, as shown by the study carried out by Binance and TripleA. Currently, more than 10 million Brazilians invest in assets, already surpassing the approximately 4 million Brazilian investors in B3 (like nasdaq and sp500 for brazilians).\\\\n\\\\nDevelopers in Brazil:\\\\nThe software developer community in Brazil is one of the most vibrant and rapidly growing in the world, reflecting the growing importance of technology and innovation in the Brazilian economy and society. With a robust technological ecosystem, Brazil has stood out not only in Latin America but globally as a significant hub for information technology talent and software development.\\\\n\\\\nSize and Growth:\\\\nAlthough specific figures may vary according to different sources, it is estimated that Brazil has over 400,000 software developers, with forecasts indicating continued growth in this number. This is partly due to investments in technological education and the increasing interest of younger generations in technology-related careers.\\\\n\\\\nEducation and Training:\\\\nBrazil boasts a strong network of higher education and technical institutions offering courses related to information technology, including software development, computer science, and computer engineering. Additionally, there\\\\\\'s a proliferation of bootcamps, online courses, and training programs that facilitate the rapid development of specific programming and technology skills, enabling more people to enter the profession.\\\\n\\\\nCommunities and Events:\\\\nThe Brazilian developer community is highly engaged, with numerous events, conferences, meetups, and hackathons regularly held across the country. These events not only provide learning and professional development opportunities but also foster collaboration, networking, and innovation.\\\\n\\\\nTechnologies and Areas of Focus:\\\\nBrazilian developers work with a wide range of technologies, from popular programming languages like JavaScript, Python, and Java, to emerging technologies such as blockchain, artificial intelligence, and the Internet of Things (IoT). There is a particular interest in software solutions for fintechs, agritech, healthtech, and edtech, reflecting the unique needs and opportunities of the Brazilian market.\\\\n\\\\nChallenges and Opportunities:\\\\nDespite the growth and dynamism of the community, there are still challenges to overcome, such as the need for greater diversity and inclusion in the tech sector and bridging specific skill gaps. However, the outlook for software developers in Brazil remains positive, with increasing demand for qualified professionals both in the domestic market and in global projects.\\\\n\\\\nIn summary, the software developer community in Brazil is a crucial component of the country\\\\\\'s technological ecosystem, playing a key role in innovation and economic development. With ongoing investments in education, training, and technological infrastructure, Brazil is well-positioned to continue its growth and impact on the global technology scene.\\\\n\\\\nWhy Not a Tech Academy in English?\\\\nThe establishment of a Tech Academy in Brazil, offering courses and training in Portuguese, is crucial given the current linguistic landscape of the country. Data reveal that only 5% of the Brazilian population speaks English, and a mere 1% are fluent in the language, according to a study by the British Council. This linguistic reality presents significant barriers to accessing technical knowledge and the latest developments in the tech sector, which are predominantly disseminated in English. Below, I discuss the main reasons why a Tech Academy in Portuguese is important in Brazil:\\\\n\\\\nDemocratization of Access to Technological Knowledge:\\\\nA Tech Academy operating in Portuguese can democratize access to technological knowledge, allowing more Brazilians, regardless of their proficiency in English, to learn about programming, software development, artificial intelligence, among other relevant topics. This is especially important in a country with as much diversity and socioeconomic inequality as Brazil.\\\\n\\\\nStimulation of Innovation and Local Development:\\\\nBy offering technological training in Portuguese, a Tech Academy can stimulate innovation and the development of technological solutions tailored to local needs. This not only contributes to the strengthening of the startup and technology ecosystem in the country but also promotes the solving of social problems through technology\\\\n\\\\nStimulation of Innovation and Local Development\\\\n\\\\nBy offering technological training in Portuguese, a Tech Academy can stimulate innovation and the development of technological solutions tailored to local needs. This not only contributes to the strengthening of the startup and technology ecosystem in the country but also promotes the solving of social problems through technology.\\\\n\\\\nSocial and Economic Inclusion\\\\n\\\\nAccessible technological training in the Portuguese language can be a powerful tool for social and economic inclusion, empowering individuals from different social strata to enter the growing technological labor market. This can help reduce economic disparities and promote a more equitable society.\\\\n\\\\nDevelopment of Local Talents\\\\n\\\\nWith the linguistic barrier mitigated, a Tech Academy in Portuguese can help identify and develop local talents, which might otherwise remain untapped. This is crucial for Brazil, which needs to expand its base of qualified technology professionals to compete globally and for the country\\\\\\'s sustainable development.\\\\n\\\\nStrengthening of the Digital Economy\\\\n\\\\nTraining more technology professionals in their native language is strategic for strengthening the Brazilian digital economy. With more developers, data scientists, and information technology specialists trained within the country, Brazil can better position itself as a leader in technological innovation in Latin America and the world.\\\\n\\\\nIn summary, the creation of a Tech Academy in Portuguese is essential to overcome the linguistic barriers that limit access to knowledge and opportunities in the tech sector. This initiative can facilitate the inclusion of a larger number of Brazilians in the dynamic technology market, in addition to contributing to the socio economic and technological development of the country.\\\\n\\\\nAbout Partner\\\\nPartner is an edtech initiative created by experienced professionals in the technology market. Their mission is to transform lives and empower individuals through quality education focused on web3 technologies and the current job market demands.\\\\n\\\\nThe program selects individuals from underserved communities and equips them with the skills needed to thrive. The intensive training program lasts from 6 to 10 months and covers a wide range of subjects, including:\\\\n\\\\nProgramming logic and Python programming\\\\nFinancial literacy and family planning\\\\nMarket types and soft skills development\\\\nEntrepreneurship and effective study techniques\\\\nCurrent technologies with an emphasis on web3 and blockchain applications\\\\nPartner boasts an impressive KPI of 85% placement rate for graduates, securing them employment in technology companies. The program goes beyond technical skills training, fostering personal transformation and preparing individuals to apply their knowledge in various aspects of their lives.\\\\n\\\\nFunding for the program comes from corporate and individual investments, which cover operational costs such as facilities, staff, educational materials, transportation, meals, and classroom equipment.\\\\n\\\\nTheir vision extends beyond education. They are actively participating in web3 projects, developing on-chain and off-chain solutions, dapps, metaverse experiences, and educational tools within this domain.\\\\n\\\\nThe program targets individuals from at-risk communities who are committed to a complete life transformation. The initiative empowers them to not only improve their own lives but also to positively influence their families, friends, and communities. Partner equips students with the essential skill of learning itself, through immersive experiences, industry expert lectures, assigned readings, hackathons, and their unique educational methodology.\\\\n\\\\nMain Objectives with the Partner\\\\\\'s Program:\\\\n\\\\nEmpower young people and adults to work and undertake in web3;\\\\n\\\\nCreate conditions for students to take on the role of active agents of change in their communities and surroundings in general;\\\\n\\\\nUse web3 technologies in their daily lives;\\\\n\\\\nPrepare professionals for the Web3 and new technologies job market;\\\\n\\\\nUnderstand business possibilities with web3;\\\\n\\\\nDevelop an innovative mindset in web3 and in any area that uses technology.\\\\n\\\\nThe entire program is FREE. Selected students receive daily transportation and snacks throughout the course. For this, we rely on donations and investments from private companies, not only in capital but also in materials for use in the classroom or for students who cannot afford the basics to maintain their studies at home.\\\\n\\\\nClasses throughout the program are in-person, with the addition of online classes, lectures, attending events, hackathons, immersions, visits to technology companies, innovation fostering, workshops, and more.\\\\n\\\\n3.2 Class Journey\\\\nMethodology\\\\n\\\\nOnline Classes\\\\n\\\\na) Recorded classes lasting 60 to 90 minutes, focusing on the modules of the subjects presented in the educational journey of the Partner formation. These classes will initially be stored in an unlisted YouTube channel and later on a platform that we are in the process of choosing for hosting. These classes will be accessible to students at any time for review or to revisit the steps presented there.\\\\n\\\\nb) Weekly masterclasses for addressing doubts and deepening the material. These masterclasses will be live with teachers who are experts in the subject.\\\\n\\\\nc) AI mentor will be fed with the content of our course and constantly updated with curated material from our team.\\\\n\\\\nd) Specific areas will be created on the Near Brasil Discord server for the students and their tasks, supported by our team and AI mentor.\\\\n\\\\ne) Bi-weekly masterclasses of 60 minutes with extra challenges for students who wish to deepen their understanding of the subject.\\\\n\\\\nf) File repository with exercise solutions and extra material curated by our team.\\\\n\\\\nFace-to-face classes\\\\n\\\\na) The face-to-face classes will be held in our classroom space with a capacity of up to 25 students. The space includes 25 machines, high-speed internet access, and a smart board.\\\\n\\\\nb) Classes will take place from Tuesday to Friday during an 8-month journey for this group, in the afternoon from 2 PM to 5 PM.\\\\n\\\\nc) All teaching materials will be created by partner team based on Near materials, combined with pedagogical methodology developed by Partner.\\\\n\\\\nd) AI mentor will be fed with the content of our course and constantly updated with curated material from our team.\\\\n\\\\ne) Specific areas will be created on the Near Brasil Discord server for the students and their tasks, supported by our team and our AI mentor.\\\\n\\\\nf) Bi-weekly masterclasses of 60 minutes with extra challenges for students who wish to deepen their understanding of the subject.\\\\n\\\\ng) File repository with exercise solutions and extra material curated by our team.\\\\n\\\\nPartner Academy - Near Journey\\\\nIntroduction to Blockchain\\\\nBlockchain Fundamentals\\\\nWeb3 Development Tools and Libraries\\\\nDrex\\\\nFinal Project\\\\nIntroduction To Near Ecosystem (8 Hours)\\\\nWhat is Near?\\\\nPractical\\\\nTech Stack\\\\nNear Infrastructure & Tooling (48 Hours)\\\\nTooling\\\\nFinal project\\\\nRust I (96 hours)\\\\nIntroduction to Rust and Development Environment\\\\nBasic Rust Concepts\\\\nOwnership and References\\\\nBasic Data Structures\\\\nEnums and Pattern Matching\\\\nError Handling\\\\nProgramming in Rust\\\\nBasic Concurrency\\\\nFile Handling and Input/Output\\\\nObject-Oriented Programming in Rust\\\\nSafe and Efficient Programming\\\\nRust for Command Line Application (CLI) Development\\\\nTesting and Documentation\\\\nPackage Publishing and Dependency Management\\\\nRust and Performance\\\\nIntegration with Other Languages\\\\nFinal Project\\\\nRust II - Advanced Rust (64 Hours)\\\\nRust for Parallel and Distributed Computing\\\\nAdvanced Concurrency\\\\nAdvanced Traits and Generics\\\\nMetaprogramming with Macros\\\\nAdvanced Error Handling\\\\nAdvanced I/O and Asynchronous Programming\\\\nUnsafe Rust\\\\nAdvanced Testing and Benchmarking\\\\nFinal Project", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "vianftbrasil.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "7000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Other"]}

{"id": 41, "body": {"name": "[REDACTED] NEAR Africa - Lagos City node | #PoweredByHackbox", "summary": "This proposal aims to create a city node in Lagos for the [REDACTED] hackathon, offering developers a space to collaborate, learn, and network. It will empower the local community to build innovative AI and Web3 solutions, benefiting the NEAR ecosystem by attracting talent and fostering innovation in Africa.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "APPROVED", "kyc_verified": true, "timeline_version": "V1", "sponsor_requested_review": true, "reviewer_completed_attestation": true}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "# Overview\\\\n\\\\nTitle: [REDACTED] City Node - Lagos\\\\nDate: October 21- 24, 2024, Format: Hybrid\\\\nLocation: ALX Hub Iponri, Lagos\\\\n\\\\n# Organizing Team \\\\n[NEAR Africa](https://twitter.com/nearafrica_) is a pivotal regional hub dedicated to advancing blockchain technology and emerging tech ecosystems across Africa. Established with a mission to foster the growth of blockchain innovation, NEAR Africa has become a key player in the NEAR Protocol ecosystem by leveraging its extensive expertise and resources. Our team has successfully held workshops on NEAR and BOS in Nigeria, hosted a [BOS hackathon](https://x.com/nearafrica_/status/1749442585054077414/video/1) in Nigeria, and more recently had a presence at EthAccra, where we onboarded new developers and entrepreneurs to NEAR and liquid staking solutions on [Meta Pool](https://x.com/nearafrica_/status/1829452391193690147).\\\\n\\\\n## Proposed Partnerships\\\\n[ALX Africa](https://www.alxafrica.com/)\\\\n[Open Source Community Africa](https://oscafrica.org/)\\\\n[Potlock](https://twitter.com/coldscollective)\\\\n[COLDS Collective](https://www.techyjaunt.com/)\\\\n[TechyJaunt](https://www.techyjaunt.com/)\\\\n[Web3 Nigeria](https://twitter.com/Web3Nigeria)\\\\n[OpenWaver](https://twitter.com/openwaver)\\\\n[Enyata](https://enyata.com/)\\\\n[Web3Bridge](https://www.web3bridgeafrica.com/)\\\\n\\\\n# Event Objectives\\\\n## Event goals\\\\n* Encourage African solutions in User-Owned AI and Chain Abstraction.\\\\n* Drive NEAR Protocol adoption across Nigeria and Africa\\\\u{2019}s developer ecosystems.\\\\n* Attract Africa\\\\\\'s tech talent to participate in global AI x Web3 collaboration.\\\\n* Strengthen connections between African and international developers.\\\\n* Highlight African innovation on the global AI and Web3 stage.\\\\n## Target Audience\\\\n* Developers and Creators skilled in AI, Web3, and blockchain technology, looking to build decentralized solutions.\\\\n* Innovators that are interested in pushing the boundaries of AI and Web3.\\\\n* Tech communities in Lagos, Nigeria, and Africa that are eager to engage in global tech challenges and gain recognition.\\\\n* Entrepreneurs and startups focused on integrating AI and blockchain into their businesses or projects.\\\\n* Students and learners keen to develop skills in AI, blockchain, and Web3 technologies.\\\\n\\\\n# Schedule and Activities\\\\nThe city node provides a physical space for developers to gather, hack, attend workshops, and network. Participants are expected to have registered and started working on their projects before attending the city node.\\\\n### Day 1: October 21, 2024 \\\\u{2013} Opening and Networking\\\\n**Morning**:\\\\n* Registration & Check-in: Participants settle in and receive event materials.\\\\n* Welcome Address: Introduction to the city node\\\\u{2019}s objectives and overview of the hackathon.\\\\n* Networking Session: Ice-breaking activities to foster connections among participants.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**Afternoon**:\\\\n* Workshop 1 \\\\u{2013} AI & Chain Abstraction: An insightful session on integrating AI with blockchain technologies.\\\\n* Open Hacking Session: Teams continue working on their projects with access to mentors and resources.\\\\n\\\\n### Day 2: October 22, 2024 \\\\u{2013} Workshops and Hacking\\\\n**Morning**:\\\\n* Workshop 2 \\\\u{2013} NEAR Protocol Deep Dive: Technical session focusing on NEAR Protocol\\\\u{2019}s integration and capabilities.\\\\n* Mentor Check-ins: Personalized support from mentors to address technical challenges and provide feedback.\\\\n\\\\n**Afternoon**:\\\\n* Open Hacking & Collaboration: Extended time for teams to collaborate on projects.\\\\n* Networking Opportunities: Additional networking sessions to engage with other participants and mentors.\\\\n\\\\n### Day 3: October 23, 2024 \\\\u{2013} Progress Review and Advanced Workshops\\\\n**Morning**:\\\\n* Mid-Hack Progress Review: Teams present project updates for mentors\\\\\\' feedback.\\\\n* Workshop 3 \\\\u{2013} Advanced AI Tools: A hands-on session introducing cutting-edge AI development tools.\\\\n\\\\n**Afternoon**:\\\\n* Open Hacking Session: Final coding and refinement of projects based on feedback received.\\\\n* Pitch Coaching Session: guidance on preparing effective project pitches for the final presentations.\\\\n\\\\n### Day 4: October 24, 2024 \\\\u{2013} Final Presentations and Closing\\\\n**Morning**:\\\\n* Final Hacking Session: Last opportunity for teams to make final adjustments to their projects.\\\\nProject Submission: Deadline for submitting final projects for review.\\\\n\\\\n### Post-Event\\\\n* Networking & Celebration: This is an opportunity for participants to network further, discuss projects, and celebrate their achievements.\\\\n* Follow-Up Activities: Continued mentorship and support for standout projects, including potential partnerships or funding opportunities.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Allignment with [REDACTED] timeline\\\\n* Remote Phase (Sept 5 - Oct 25, 2024): Participants will have been working on their projects during the remote phase, using online resources and support.\\\\n* In-Person Finale (Nov 9-11, 2024): The hackathon concludes with an in-person event in Bangkok, Thailand, where winners will be announced. Travel scholarships are available for qualifying participants.\\\\n\\\\n# Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)\\\\nWe expect to achieve the following KPIs:\\\\n* Attract over 200 developers.\\\\n* Engage at least 100 hackathon participants.\\\\n* Generate a minimum of 20 innovative projects.\\\\n* Expose them to the various bounties offered by [REDACTED]\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n# Budget\\\\nProposed Budget: [View Budget Spreadsheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1lSDllff7DcIRQ0IW8RunGDDl5QwJbpEWJrqQlAURgMY/edit?gid=1617507834#gid=1617507834)\\\\n### Team members to be transported\\\\n[Earnest Etim](https://near.social/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.Post?id=1003#/mob.near/widget/ProfilePage?accountId=earnestetim.near)\\\\n[Victor Kanu](https://near.social/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.Post?id=1003#/mob.near/widget/ProfilePage?accountId=victorkanu1.near)\\\\n[Peace Paul](https://near.social/astraplusplus.ndctools.near/widget/home?page=dao&daoId=near-africa.sputnik-dao.near#/mob.near/widget/ProfilePage?accountId=ememobong.near)\\\\n[Misheal Charles](https://near.social/astraplusplus.ndctools.near/widget/home?page=dao&daoId=near-africa.sputnik-dao.near#/mob.near/widget/ProfilePage?accountId=justt-mish.near)\\\\n# Bounties\\\\nThe developers will already be hacking for bounties provided by [[REDACTED]](https://redacted.devpost.com/)\\\\n# Judging Criteria\\\\nThe judging criteria for the hackathon are provided by [REDACTED]. This ensures alignment with their goals and objectives for evaluating innovative solutions across Chain Abstraction, AI, and Web3 intersections.\\\\n# Marketing Strategy\\\\n* **Partnership Leverage**: Collaborate with ALX Africa, OSCA, Potlock, COLDS Collective, TechyJaunt, Web3 Nigeria, OpenWaver, Enyata, and Web3Bridge to promote the event to their networks, providing direct access to developers and Web3 communities.\\\\n* **Social Media Campaigns**: Use Twitter, LinkedIn, Telegram, and Instagram to run targeted campaigns, highlight workshops, and promote prizes. Collaborate with tech influencers to expand reach.\\\\n* **Developer Outreach**: deploy email campaigns and organize pre-event webinars with partners like Web3 Nigeria and Web3Bridge to engage and prepare participants.\\\\n* **Media and Content**: Partner with TechyJaunt for pre- and post-event coverage, live-stream sessions, and real-time updates through social media for virtual engagement.\\\\n* **Community Engagement**: Encourage participants and partners to share content using event-specific hashtags, amplifying the event\\\\\\'s visibility.\\\\n# Contact Information\\\\nTwitter: https://x.com/nearafrica_\\\\nTelegram: https://t.co/ojH3sEuy9Y\\\\nEmail: nearafrican@gmail.com\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "ear-nest.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "12000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackbox", "Hackathon"]}
